timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                // @JsonProperty(value = "result", access = JsonProperty.Access.WRITE_ONLY)
timeline.author: fde312

timeline.bodyText: I think something is odd in this method. I am not seeing where you are adding the result for the case when this.results == null
timeline.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: Yes, that's true, thanks for noticing. As it turns out the case this.results == null never occurs. (Or so far it should never occur) I'll remove it.
replies.author: SimonEntholzer

timeline.bodyText: I am not quire sure what is happening here. As far as I know we only have one result at the moment, therefore this would remove the last result (the one result at the moment) and then add the same result back, right? Or am I misunderstanding here something?
timeline.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: It removes the last result, but the result passed to the method isn't the same result. So, a different result is set to the results list.
replies.author: SimonEntholzer

timeline.bodyText: I think that we should not delete any result at all except for special reasons
timeline.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: We still should make sure that the deletion is also propagated to the database. We should write a test for that probably.
replies.author: SimonEntholzer

timeline.bodyText: this returns the result with the highest Id right?
timeline.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: Technically "latest" means the newest result? It might be great to add that information in the comment above
replies.author: ivanchimeno

replies.bodyText: We do not order the results by ID, we have a specific order_column which is handled by hibernate only. But yes, the latest result means the newest result
replies.author: anditurdiu

timeline.message:
Update src/main/java/de/tum/in/www1/artemis/domain/Submission.java

Co-authored-by: Francisco De las Casas Young <41108487+fde312@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: I am not sure if it would be better to not export this function and rename it to getLatestResult then you can call this directly from a submission, e.g. const result = this.submission.getLatestResult()
timeline.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: This does not work in typescript because there is no actual object submission in runtime. You cant really work in an object oriented way
replies.author: anditurdiu

timeline.bodyText: It would be better to save the result in a global variable instead of using the method in the check. See also other places where you are doing this that way (e.g. line 57)
timeline.author: fde312
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,7 +53,9 @@

- {{ submission.result.score }} % +

replies.bodyText: I agree, in the html we should avoid method calls
replies.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: The refactoring of the function calls within the HTML will be done in a followup PR next week!
replies.author: nicolasruscher

timeline.bodyText: wuuut :D
timeline.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: This is used as a workaround to make the function available within the HTML. This will be gone once the refactoring is done next week!
replies.author: nicolasruscher

timeline.bodyText: Please save the result in a local variable
timeline.author: fde312

timeline.bodyText: Please save the result in a local/global variable
timeline.author: fde312

timeline.bodyText: Please save the result in a global variable and change it also in the html accordingly
timeline.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: This is a reoccurring thing, so check also the other parts where getLatestSubmissionResult is used :)
replies.author: fde312

timeline.message: fixed replaceLatestOrIfEmptyAddResult to be easier understandable

timeline.bodyText: Should the comment be removed since you renamed the ignored property?
timeline.author: ivanchimeno

replies.bodyText: Yes, we removed it
replies.author: SimonEntholzer

timeline.message: refactored and cleaned up use of getLatestSubmissionResult()

timeline.bodyText: Quick question: isn't !!getLatestSubmissionResult(submission) the same as getLatestSubmissionResult(submission) (so that we can simply omit the !!)?
timeline.author: ivanchimeno

replies.bodyText: In theory !! forces the expression to evaluate to a boolean, so that is likely the reason it is used here.
replies.author: FrankeLukas

replies.bodyText: As @FrankeLukas stated correctly, we enforce an evaluation as a boolean :)
replies.author: nicolasruscher

timeline.bodyText: @fde312 mentioned below that it might be better to refactor that into a variable so that we avoid long html
timeline.author: ivanchimeno

@@ -37,7 +37,7 @@

{{ submission.submissionDate | date: 'MMM d, y HH:mm:ss' }} {{ submission.participation.submissions?.length }} - {{ submission.result.score }}% + {{ getLatestSubmissionResult(submission)!.score }}%

replies.bodyText: Yes thats right, thanks! We will refactor that in a followup PR next week.

replies.bodyText: We fixed this with the new commits.

timeline.bodyText: What is the correct submissions result?

replies.bodyText: I think this needs a little more elaboration :)

replies.bodyText: This should also be fixed now.

timeline.bodyText: What happens with an empty array? Then you would set submission.results[-1] = result
timeline.author: stefanwaldhauser

timeline.message: small fix
reset renaming of setResults()
re-refactored replaceLatestOrIfEmptyAddResult to addResult
refactored methods which didnt refactor automatically
removed a redundant second submission.addResult in DatabaseUtilService

timeline.bodyText: It looks like this is mostly/only used for clearing results. Wouldn't it make more sense to add a dedicated clear method? (This way we also don't allocate a new ArrayList each time we just want to throw the old results away.)
timeline.author: FrankeLukas

replies.bodyText: Yes for now its only used for that, but the method will be used for the upcoming multi correction feature, therefore we should keep the name for now.
replies.author: nicolasruscher

replies.bodyText: I was more trying to suggest creating a new method which is just used for clearing. Or will clearing get obsolete once we have multi correction?
replies.author: FrankeLukas

timeline.bodyText:
I have never seen this in production java code before. I also found this online. Could you maybe throw a normal Exception here? Or is there a specific reason you used assert here that I miss.
https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_Programming/Keywords/assert#:~:text=assert%20is%20a%20Java%20keyword,runtime%20system%20throws%20an%20AssertionError%20.
Assertions are usually used as a debugging aid. They should not be used instead of validating arguments to public methods, or in place of a more precise runtime error exception.
timeline.author: stefanwaldhauser

replies.bodyText: We changed it to throw an Exception. This check will be removed later, as with second corrections enabled we will need longer Submission.results lists.
replies.author: SimonEntholzer

timeline.message: changed result to manual result in ProgrammingAssessmentIntegrationTest to fix build fail
changed assert to Exception
fixed Exception mistake
